column5: Hey Gang!  It's been a while since I've posted anything here. Been lurking but not really posting much being that I mostly fish the surf and salt now. Been down here on Long Island for almost 5 years already. Learning, re-learning the ins and outs of working the extremly harsh conditions down here. Got me a fleet of kayaks and a couple of boston whalers to get out on the water but putting on the wet suit and hopping boulders and getting pummeled off rocks in the surf has taken over most of my free time... LOVE IT!          These shots are from Montauk Point on the end of long Island.    School of bait getting blitzed!      30lb class fish crashing the breakers!           Bigger the storm, better the fishing! I've gotten to see some amazing things over the last few years fishing down here.Hopefully going into another great season. If any of ya ever make yer way down here and wanna have a good ole time drop me a line!   FHR
WOW !!! Awesome report Rick ! Great pics too. Thanks   Paul
Good to see you again Ric! HH
Been a long time for sure Ric, good to have you back.
Really nice to hear from you Ric. Looks like you've settled in there just fine.
Definitely miss your reports....even with the salt they're still great!

Hey boys! I'll try to post more as the season progresses.  It's been rough getting my fishing time in.  Working two jobs for a while now. Sleep or fish.... hmmmm. You know what I'm choosing.  The bags under my eyes in the fall are big but sos the smile.  Tight lines folks! Winters over! Go get em!  FHR
Good to hear from you again!  Some great pictures there...and love the BIG fish!
Great to see you Ric! Pics are blocked at work but will check them out tonight.  Edit - Great pics and fish.
Exhilerating fishing to say the least! I didn't know you before, but its good to have you back.
Well well,it,s the lost one.LOL  Nice to hear from you Ric.Great pics.
Wow Ric, great to hear from you, those are some great shots, looks like you're doing well   What kind  of fish are those in your shots???  Maureen
Nice to hear from you Ric, been awhile for sure.  Great photos and some nice fish there
Great to see your doing well!

Ladies, gents... Those are Striped Bass in these pics. (My new Pike) biggest one to date was about 52" and about 50lbsyou but the will get up into the 75-90lb range. It's been nice eating fish again... Toronto pike never made it to my dinner table!!!  FHR
Great to see ya here again Ric great pics I love the one with the school in the wave that is very cool.  Have a blast and keep us up to date
Great Pics Ric! Good to see your still breathing!
Yeah man... Nice to see yer still fishing and hanging around here too.  Great stripers.
